snippet: The state attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, is investigating allegations of financial malfeasance involving William E. Rapfogel, the president of the Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty.
abstract: William E Rapfogel, longtime Jewish community leader who ran Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty one of New York City’s most influential and well-connected social service organizations, has been fired from his job; he is under investigation, accused of asking one of the organization’s insurance companies to make political contributions on his behalf to Democratic candidates in New York City mayoral race.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The state attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, is investigating allegations of financial malfeasance involving William E. Rapfogel, the president of the Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty.

headline.main: Power Broker, Fired, Faces Inquiry on Political Donations
headline.print_headline: Power Broker, Fired, Faces Inquiry on Political Donations
